detaileddescription.para:
Reposition the children of an object. (Called recursively)
obj
pointer to an object which children will be repositioned
x_diff
x coordinate shift
y_diff
y coordinate shift

Refresh the style of all children of an object. (Called recursively)
style_p
refresh objects only with this style.
obj
pointer to an object

Recursively refresh the style of the children. Go deeper until a not NULL style is found because the NULL styles are inherited from the parent
obj
pointer to an object

Called by 'lv_obj_del' to delete the children objects
obj
pointer to an object (all of its children will be deleted)

Handle the drawing related tasks of the base objects.
obj
pointer to an object
mask
the object will be drawn only in this area
mode
LV_DESIGN_COVER_CHK: only check if the object fully covers the 'mask_p' area (return 'true' if yes) LV_DESIGN_DRAW: draw the object (always return 'true')
return
true/false, depends on 'mode'

Signal function of the basic object
obj
pointer to an object
sign
signal type
param
parameter for the signal (depends on signal type)
LV_RES_OK: the object is not deleted in the function; LV_RES_INV: the object is deleted
Init. the 'lv' library.

Create a basic object
parent
pointer to a parent object. If NULL then a screen will be created
copy
pointer to a base object, if not NULL then the new object will be copied from it
pointer to the new object

Delete 'obj' and all of its children
obj
pointer to an object to delete
LV_RES_INV because the object is deleted

Delete all children of an object
obj
pointer to an object

Mark the object as invalid therefore its current position will be redrawn by 'lv_refr_task'
obj
pointer to an object

Set a new parent for an object. Its relative position will be the same.
obj
pointer to an object. Can't be a screen.
parent
pointer to the new parent object. (Can't be NULL)

Move and object to the foreground
obj
pointer to an object

Move and object to the background
obj
pointer to an object

Set relative the position of an object (relative to the parent)
obj
pointer to an object
x
new distance from the left side of the parent
y
new distance from the top of the parent

Set the x coordinate of a object
obj
pointer to an object
x
new distance from the left side from the parent

Set the y coordinate of a object
obj
pointer to an object
y
new distance from the top of the parent

Set the size of an object
obj
pointer to an object
w
new width
h
new height

Set the width of an object
obj
pointer to an object
w
new width

Set the height of an object
obj
pointer to an object
h
new height

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_obj_t *obj, const lv_obj_t *base, lv_align_t align, lv_coord_t x_mod, lv_coord_t y_mod)
memberdef.name: lv_obj_align

detaileddescription.para:
Align an object to an other object.
obj
pointer to an object to align
base
pointer to an object (if NULL the parent is used). 'obj' will be aligned to it.
align
type of alignment (see 'lv_align_t' enum)
x_mod
x coordinate shift after alignment
y_mod
y coordinate shift after alignment

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_obj_t *obj, const lv_obj_t *base, lv_align_t align, lv_coord_t x_mod, lv_coord_t y_mod)
memberdef.name: lv_obj_align_origo

detaileddescription.para:
Align an object to an other object.
obj
pointer to an object to align
base
pointer to an object (if NULL the parent is used). 'obj' will be aligned to it.
align
type of alignment (see 'lv_align_t' enum)
x_mod
x coordinate shift after alignment
y_mod
y coordinate shift after alignment

Realign the object based on the last lv_obj_align parameters.
obj
pointer to an object

Enable the automatic realign of the object when its size has changed based on the last lv_obj_align parameters.
obj
pointer to an object
en
true: enable auto realign; false: disable auto realign

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_obj_t *obj, lv_coord_t left, lv_coord_t right, lv_coord_t top, lv_coord_t bottom)
memberdef.name: lv_obj_set_ext_click_area

detaileddescription.para:
Set the size of an extended clickable area If TINY mode is used, only the largest of the horizontal and vertical padding values are considered.
obj
pointer to an object
left
extended clickable are on the left [px]
right
extended clickable are on the right [px]
top
extended clickable are on the top [px]
bottom
extended clickable are on the bottom [px]

Set a new style for an object
obj
pointer to an object
style_p
pointer to the new style

Notify an object about its style is modified
obj
pointer to an object

Notify all object if a style is modified
style
pointer to a style. Only the objects with this style will be notified (NULL to notify all objects)

Hide an object. It won't be visible and clickable.
obj
pointer to an object
en
true: hide the object

Enable or disable the clicking of an object
obj
pointer to an object
en
true: make the object clickable

Enable to bring this object to the foreground if it or any of its children is clicked
obj
pointer to an object
en
true: enable the auto top feature

Enable the dragging of an object
obj
pointer to an object
en
true: make the object dragable

Set the directions an object can be dragged in
obj
pointer to an object
drag_dir
bitwise OR of allowed directions an object can be dragged in

Enable the throwing of an object after is is dragged
obj
pointer to an object
en
true: enable the drag throw

Enable to use parent for drag related operations. If trying to drag the object the parent will be moved instead
obj
pointer to an object
en
true: enable the 'drag parent' for the object

Propagate the events to the parent too
obj
pointer to an object
en
true: enable the event propagation

Set the opa scale enable parameter (required to set opa_scale with lv_obj_set_opa_scale())
obj
pointer to an object
en
true: opa scaling is enabled for this object and all children; false: no opa scaling

Set the opa scale of an object
obj
pointer to an object
opa_scale
a factor to scale down opacity [0..255]

Set a bit or bits in the protect filed
obj
pointer to an object
prot
'OR'-ed values from lv_protect_t

Clear a bit or bits in the protect filed
obj
pointer to an object
prot
'OR'-ed values from lv_protect_t

Set a an event handler function for an object. Used by the user to react on event which happens with the object.
obj
pointer to an object
event_cb
the new event function

Send an event to the object
obj
pointer to an object
event
the type of the event from lv_event_t
data
arbitrary data depending on the object type and the event. (Usually NULL)
LV_RES_OK: obj was not deleted in the event; LV_RES_INV: obj was deleted in the event

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_event_cb_t event_xcb, lv_obj_t *obj, lv_event_t event, const void *data)
memberdef.name: lv_event_send_func

detaileddescription.para:
Call an event function with an object, event, and data.
event_xcb
an event callback function. If NULL LV_RES_OK will return without any actions. (the 'x' in the argument name indicates that its not a fully generic function because it not follows the func_name(object, callback, ...) convention)
obj
pointer to an object to associate with the event (can be NULL to simply call the event_cb)
event
an event
data
pointer to a custom data
LV_RES_OK: obj was not deleted in the event; LV_RES_INV: obj was deleted in the event

Get the data parameter of the current event
the data parameter

Set the a signal function of an object. Used internally by the library. Always call the previous signal function in the new.
obj
pointer to an object
cb
the new signal function

Send an event to the object
obj
pointer to an object
event
the type of the event from lv_event_t.

Set a new design function for an object
obj
pointer to an object
design_cb
the new design function

Allocate a new ext. data for an object
obj
pointer to an object
ext_size
the size of the new ext. data
Normal pointer to the allocated ext

Send a 'LV_SIGNAL_REFR_EXT_SIZE' signal to the object
obj
pointer to an object

Return with the screen of an object
obj
pointer to an object
pointer to a screen

Get the display of an object
scr
pointer to an object
pointer the object's display

Returns with the parent of an object
obj
pointer to an object
pointer to the parent of 'obj'

Iterate through the children of an object (start from the "youngest")
obj
pointer to an object
child
NULL at first call to get the next children and the previous return value later
the child after 'act_child' or NULL if no more child

Iterate through the children of an object (start from the "oldest")
obj
pointer to an object
child
NULL at first call to get the next children and the previous return value later
the child after 'act_child' or NULL if no more child

Count the children of an object (only children directly on 'obj')
obj
pointer to an object
children number of 'obj'

Recursively count the children of an object
obj
pointer to an object
children number of 'obj'

Copy the coordinates of an object to an area
obj
pointer to an object
cords_p
pointer to an area to store the coordinates

Reduce area retried by lv_obj_get_coords() the get graphically usable area of an object. (Without the size of the border or other extra graphical elements)
coords_p
store the result area here

Get the x coordinate of object
obj
pointer to an object
distance of 'obj' from the left side of its parent

Get the y coordinate of object
obj
pointer to an object
distance of 'obj' from the top of its parent

Get the width of an object
obj
pointer to an object
the width

Get the height of an object
obj
pointer to an object
the height

Get that width reduced by the left and right padding.
obj
pointer to an object
the width which still fits into the container

Get that height reduced by the top an bottom padding.
obj
pointer to an object
the height which still fits into the container

Get the automatic realign property of the object.
obj
pointer to an object
true: auto realign is enabled; false: auto realign is disabled

Get the left padding of extended clickable area
obj
pointer to an object
the extended left padding

Get the right padding of extended clickable area
obj
pointer to an object
the extended right padding

Get the top padding of extended clickable area
obj
pointer to an object
the extended top padding

Get the bottom padding of extended clickable area
obj
pointer to an object
the extended bottom padding

Get the extended size attribute of an object
obj
pointer to an object
the extended size attribute

Get the style pointer of an object (if NULL get style of the parent)
obj
pointer to an object
pointer to a style

Get the hidden attribute of an object
obj
pointer to an object
true: the object is hidden

Get the click enable attribute of an object
obj
pointer to an object
true: the object is clickable

Get the top enable attribute of an object
obj
pointer to an object
true: the auto top feture is enabled

Get the drag enable attribute of an object
obj
pointer to an object
true: the object is dragable

Get the directions an object can be dragged
obj
pointer to an object
bitwise OR of allowed directions an object can be dragged in

Get the drag throw enable attribute of an object
obj
pointer to an object
true: drag throw is enabled

Get the drag parent attribute of an object
obj
pointer to an object
true: drag parent is enabled

Get the drag parent attribute of an object
obj
pointer to an object
true: drag parent is enabled

Get the opa scale enable parameter
obj
pointer to an object
true: opa scaling is enabled for this object and all children; false: no opa scaling

Get the opa scale parameter of an object
obj
pointer to an object
opa scale [0..255]

Get the protect field of an object
obj
pointer to an object
protect field ('OR'ed values of lv_protect_t)

Check at least one bit of a given protect bitfield is set
obj
pointer to an object
prot
protect bits to test ('OR'ed values of lv_protect_t)
false: none of the given bits are set, true: at least one bit is set

Get the signal function of an object
obj
pointer to an object
the signal function

Get the design function of an object
obj
pointer to an object
the design function

Get the event function of an object
obj
pointer to an object
the event function

Get the ext pointer
obj
pointer to an object
the ext pointer but not the dynamic version Use it as ext->data1, and NOT da(ext)->data1

Get object's and its ancestors type. Put their name in type_buf starting with the current type. E.g. buf.type[0]="lv_btn", buf.type[1]="lv_cont", buf.type[2]="lv_obj"
obj
pointer to an object which type should be get
buf
pointer to an lv_obj_type_t buffer to store the types

Get the object's user data
obj
pointer to an object
user data

Get a pointer to the object's user data
obj
pointer to an object
pointer to the user data

Set the object's user data. The data will be copied.
obj
pointer to an object
data
user data

Get the group of the object
obj
pointer to an object
the pointer to group of the object

Tell whether the object is the focused object of a group or not.
obj
pointer to an object
true: the object is focused, false: the object is not focused or not in a group
